definitions.definition: To reflect , as in a mirror.
To act as a reflection of, either by being identical to, or by being identical but reversed.
examples: The placement of the paintings mirrored the positions of the windows on the opposite wall.

definitions.definition: Of an event , activity , behavior , to be identical to; to be a copy of; to imitate closely.
examples: He tried to mirror Elvis's life by copying his fashion and mannerisms.

definitions.definition: To create something identical to (a website , etc.).

main_definition: ( transitive ) To reflect , as in a mirror.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To act as a reflection of, either by being identical to, or by being identical but reversed.
( transitive ) Of an event , activity , behavior , to be identical to; to be a copy of; to imitate closely.
( transitive , computing , Internet ) To create something identical to (a website , etc.).
